communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Chad Bianco Jetset Lifestyle
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello, 

I am requesting records related to Sheriff Chad Bianco's travels to Washington DC or any political event where he traveled to give a speech or be a guest. This includes anyone from the department who has accompanied him. 

Records related include:
Expenses: receipts, filed expense reports associated with traveling (including flights, transportation, security, food) 
Days of vacation used, or whether vacation time was used whatsoever
Itineraries and calendars related to his travels

Search 2020 through 2024

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am seeking any information in regards to departmental policy in regards to an officer identification  with the public furthermore, any policy in which the officer must state their name and badge identification number by the general public. In Addition, I am  seeking any department policy in regards to the body-worn camera, Bodycam (BWC), Dashboard Camera Traffic Stop or any recording device which may record audio or video from the 8:45 PM traffic stop on Old Town Road by Officer W. Carroll.

The requested documents are requested to prepare a legal defense to the several traffic violation, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert M. Scott

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Michigan State Capitol ZeroEyes Data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) The contract entered into on or around November 20, 2023, including the price and dates, between the Michigan state capitol and ZeroEyes for use of ZeroEyes’ artificial intelligence gun detection software;

2) Any records showing the number of times the ZeroEyes software has raised an alert between its implementation on or around November 20, 2023 and the present; and

3) Any records documenting false positive or false negative alarms raised by the ZeroEyes software during the same period, where a false positive is defined as an event in which the system incorrectly identified a non-weapon object as a weapon and a false negative is defined as an event in which the system failed to detect a weapon.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Maggie Dougherty

title: Data on school-based arrests (Marlborough Police Department)

communications.communication:
To whoever it may concern:  
  

This letter constitutes a request pursuant to the Public Records Act, M. G. L.c.66, §10, for public records in the custody of your police department. 

Under the Criminal Justice Reform Act, school districts and law enforcement agencies must “specify the manner and division of responsibility for collecting and reporting the school-based arrests, citations and court referrals of students to the Department of Elementary and Secondary Education” (DESE). DESE began collecting data on school-related arrests in the 2018-19 school year. In the 2019-20 school year, DESE has expanded that collection to include data on all referrals to law enforcement. DESE has defined these terms as follows, borrowing the same definitions used by the U.S. Department of Education since its 2009 Civil Rights Data Collection.  

A school-related arrest “[r]efers to an arrest of a student for any activity conducted on school grounds, during off campus school activities (including while taking school transportation), or due to a referral by any school official. All school-related arrests are considered referrals to law enforcement.”  

A referral to law enforcement “[i]s an action by which a student is reported to any law enforcement agency or official, including a school police unit, for an incident that occurs on school grounds, during school-related events, or while taking school transportation, regardless of whether official action is taken. Citations, tickets, court referrals, and school-related arrests are considered referrals to law enforcement.”  

  

I request the following public records, as defined in M. G. L.c. 4, § 7 (twenty-sixth):  

  

1. An extract of your records management system or database that includes each school-related arrest and each referral to law enforcement conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022, and 2022-2023 school year (up until the day the records are produced). Specifically, we request an extract of the database to include the following columns:  

a. Date of arrest or referral to law enforcement  

b. Time of arrest or referral to law enforcement  

c. Charge (or charges)  

d. Whether the individual(s) was arrested or referred to law enforcement  

e. Sex of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement  

f. Age of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement  

g. Race of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement  

h. Ethnicity of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement  

i. Disability status of the individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement  

j. Whether the individual arrested or referred to law enforcement is a student at the school. 

k. Name of arresting officer, if applicable, and  

l. Badge number of the arresting officer or the officer that referred the youth to law enforcement, as applicable.  

  

2. If such an extract of the database in question 1 is not possible, please provide police reports and school incident reports on each school-related arrest conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022, and 2022-2023 school year (up until the day the records are produced).  

  

3. Please provide an unduplicated count of arrested students for each school year including 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022, and 2022-2023 school year (up until the day the records are produced).  

  

4. If such an extract of the database in question 1 is not possible, please provide police reports and school incident reports on each referral to law enforcement conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022, and 2022-2023 school year (up until the day the records are produced), per the U.S. Department of Education’s Civil Rights Data Collection for that year. For each referral to law enforcement, please include the school, demographic, and incident information described in DESE’s School Safety and Discipline Report Data Handbook v. 20.0.  

  

5. Please also provide an unduplicated counts of referrals to law enforcement (as defined above) for each school year including 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022 and 2022-2023 school year (up until the day the records are produced).   

As this request involves a matter of public interest and will not be used for any commercial purpose, we ask that all fees associated with this request be waived pursuant to 950 C.M.R. 32.07(2)(k). The purpose of this request is to determine whether your school district and police department are complying with their reporting obligations under the Criminal Justice Reform Act. “The public has an interest in knowing whether public servants are carrying out their duties in an efficient and law-abiding manner.”  

  

It would be ill-advised to impose a fee for data that your police department may have failed to report in violation of statutory and regulatory duty. Moreover, as you know, municipalities with a population of over 20,000 may not assess a fee for the first 2 hours of time spent searching for, compiling, segregating, redacting and reproducing a requested record. Finally, pursuant to 950 C.M.R. 32.07(2)(i), a records access officer shall assess no fee greater than the lowest hourly rate of a person capable of compiling, segregating, redacting and reproducing a requested record. In the event that a charge is incurred for this request which you will not waive, please so indicate and include an itemization of estimated good faith costs.  

Please provide public records to a requestor in an electronic format unless the record is not available in an electronic format. M. G. L.c 66, § 6A(d).  

The Public Records Act requires that you comply with this request within ten (10) business days following receipt. If you believe that documents or data responsive to any request herein is not public record and thus not subject to disclosure, please set forth in writing the specific reasons for such assertion, including the specific exemption or exemptions that you believe apply. To the extent that you determine that records need to be redacted in order to be produced under any law protecting the privacy of named individuals, please do so rather than withholding them in their entirety. 

If you have any questions about this request, or need additional time to respond, please contact me. Thank you in advance for your prompt response to this request.  

  

Sincerely,  

Katherine Stathulis

J.D. Research Fellow

Center for Public Interest, Advocacy, and Collaboration 

Northeastern University School of Law

k.stathulis@northeastern.edu
  
617-373-5862

communications.communication:
To whoever it may concern:  
  

This letter constitutes a request pursuant to the Public Records Act, M. G. L.c.66, §10, for public records in the custody of your police department. 

Under the Criminal Justice Reform Act, school districts and law enforcement agencies must “specify the manner and division of responsibility for collecting and reporting the school-based arrests, citations and court referrals of students to the Department of Elementary and Secondary Education” (DESE). DESE began collecting data on school-related arrests in the 2018-19 school year. In the 2019-20 school year, DESE has expanded that collection to include data on all referrals to law enforcement. DESE has defined these terms as follows, borrowing the same definitions used by the U.S. Department of Education since its 2009 Civil Rights Data Collection.  

A school-related arrest “[r]efers to an arrest of a student for any activity conducted on school grounds, during off campus school activities (including while taking school transportation), or due to a referral by any school official. All school-related arrests are considered referrals to law enforcement.”  

A referral to law enforcement “[i]s an action by which a student is reported to any law enforcement agency or official, including a school police unit, for an incident that occurs on school grounds, during school-related events, or while taking school transportation, regardless of whether official action is taken. Citations, tickets, court referrals, and school-related arrests are considered referrals to law enforcement.”  

  

I request the following public records, as defined in M. G. L.c. 4, § 7 (twenty-sixth):  

  

1. An extract of your records management system or database that includes each school-related arrest and each referral to law enforcement conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022, and 2022-2023 school year (up until the day the records are produced). Specifically, we request an extract of the database to include the following columns:  

a. Date of arrest or referral to law enforcement  

b. Time of arrest or referral to law enforcement  

c. Charge (or charges)  

d. Whether the individual(s) was arrested or referred to law enforcement  

e. Sex of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement  

f. Age of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement  

g. Race of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement  

h. Ethnicity of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement  

i. Disability status of the individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement  

j. Whether the individual arrested or referred to law enforcement is a student at the school. 

k. Name of arresting officer, if applicable, and  

l. Badge number of the arresting officer or the officer that referred the youth to law enforcement, as applicable.  

  

2. If such an extract of the database in question 1 is not possible, please provide police reports and school incident reports on each school-related arrest conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022, and 2022-2023 school year (up until the day the records are produced).  

  

3. Please provide an unduplicated count of arrested students for each school year including 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022, and 2022-2023 school year (up until the day the records are produced).  

  

4. If such an extract of the database in question 1 is not possible, please provide police reports and school incident reports on each referral to law enforcement conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022, and 2022-2023 school year (up until the day the records are produced), per the U.S. Department of Education’s Civil Rights Data Collection for that year. For each referral to law enforcement, please include the school, demographic, and incident information described in DESE’s School Safety and Discipline Report Data Handbook v. 20.0.  

  

5. Please also provide an unduplicated counts of referrals to law enforcement (as defined above) for each school year including 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022 and 2022-2023 school year (up until the day the records are produced).   

As this request involves a matter of public interest and will not be used for any commercial purpose, we ask that all fees associated with this request be waived pursuant to 950 C.M.R. 32.07(2)(k). The purpose of this request is to determine whether your school district and police department are complying with their reporting obligations under the Criminal Justice Reform Act. “The public has an interest in knowing whether public servants are carrying out their duties in an efficient and law-abiding manner.”  

  

It would be ill-advised to impose a fee for data that your police department may have failed to report in violation of statutory and regulatory duty. Moreover, as you know, municipalities with a population of over 20,000 may not assess a fee for the first 2 hours of time spent searching for, compiling, segregating, redacting and reproducing a requested record. Finally, pursuant to 950 C.M.R. 32.07(2)(i), a records access officer shall assess no fee greater than the lowest hourly rate of a person capable of compiling, segregating, redacting and reproducing a requested record. In the event that a charge is incurred for this request which you will not waive, please so indicate and include an itemization of estimated good faith costs.  

Please provide public records to a requestor in an electronic format unless the record is not available in an electronic format. M. G. L.c 66, § 6A(d).  

The Public Records Act requires that you comply with this request within ten (10) business days following receipt. If you believe that documents or data responsive to any request herein is not public record and thus not subject to disclosure, please set forth in writing the specific reasons for such assertion, including the specific exemption or exemptions that you believe apply. To the extent that you determine that records need to be redacted in order to be produced under any law protecting the privacy of named individuals, please do so rather than withholding them in their entirety. 

If you have any questions about this request, or need additional time to respond, please contact me. Thank you in advance for your prompt response to this request.  

  

Sincerely,  

Katherine Stathulis

J.D. Research Fellow

Center for Public Interest, Advocacy, and Collaboration 

Northeastern University School of Law

k.stathulis@northeastern.edu
  
617-373-5862

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Alaska Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All policies or manuals describing the
  - deployment,
  - personnel training,
  - data access,
  - data retention,
  - data sharing,
  - public oversight,
... of unmanned ground, water, and aerial vehicles.

In the meaning of this request, "unmanned ... vehicle" is inclusive of all self-mobile machines in which the operator is remote to the vehicle's chassis or fuselage; or the vehicle is autonomous or semi-autonomous. These are often referred to as drones or robots.

The most current inventory of unmanned ground, water, and aerial vehicles and accessories or payloads.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

B. Charles Reynolds

communications.subject: Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act Request: Bellevue Capital emails
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All emails sent between the office and Bellevue Capital Partners LLC or Bellevue Capital Ventures between Nov. 1, 2024 and present. communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Cecile Richards
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning or describing Cecile Richards, the former Planned Parenthood President. Her death was noteworthy and widely covered by the press: https://www.cnn.com/2025/01/20/us/cecile-richards-death-planned-parenthood/index.html

https://www.npr.org/2025/01/20/nx-s1-5199767/cecile-richards-planned-parenthood-brain-cancer

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. This is also to include any responsive records held in offsite locations, such as the Alexandria Records Center. Please include both investigatory and non-investigatory records in your search.

If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have previously written about the government and its activities, and am currently a reporter of The Boston Globe.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexa Gagosz

title: USS Liberty: US Navy Court of Inquiry Report Submitted by Court to Convening Authority

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: USS Liberty: US Navy Court of Inquiry Report Submitted by Court to Convening Authority
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am a USS Liberty attack survivor and Historian of the USS Liberty Veterans Association

On June 8, 1967, the combined forces of the Israel Air Force and Navy attacked the USS Liberty (AGTR-5).

Following that attack, the US Navy convened a Court of Inquiry to investigate all aspects of the attack.

We've confirmed that the public version of the US Navy Court of Inquiry Report omits significant evidence and testimony.

Among them:

•	“Appendix C”, is referenced on page 21 of 23 of the Summary of Events as being included in the Report, but is not.

•	USS Liberty survivor Lloyd Painter’s testimony describing his witnessing the deliberate machine gunning of life rafts we had dropped over the side in anticipation of abandoning ship. This testimony is not included in the publicly released copy of the US Navy Court of Inquiry Report.

•	Several of the USS Liberty survivors who testified before the Court testified that in their opinion the attack was deliberate. An Associated Press article (June 17, 1967) and an NSA message both cited this. None of this testimony is included in the publicly released copy of the US Navy Court of Inquiry Report.

We are requesting a copy of the US Navy Court of Inquiry Report that was submitted by the Court to ADM John S. McCain, Jr. who, as Convening Authority, authorized the US Navy Court of Inquiry. NOT ANOTHER COPY OF THE US NAVY COURT OF INQUIRY REPORT THAT HAS BEEN RELEASED TO THE PUBLIC.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joe Meadors

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Chainalysis Correction on North Korea
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Communication between the blockchain surveillance provider Chainalysis and the Dept of Treasury notifying the Dept of Chainalysis' recent correction of laundered cryptocurrency funds attributed to North Korea/DPRK from $1B down to $660M (please find the corresponding statement here: https://www.chainalysis.com/blog/crypto-hacking-stolen-funds-2025/)

As an independent journalist I asked that all fees be waived.

Please note that the records requested are supplemental to information already in the public domain. Under Executive Order 13526, Section 1.7, classified information that is already publicly available or improperly classified to conceal violations of law, inefficiency, or administrative error cannot be withheld under Exemption 1.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Lola Leetz

title: DEA data collected on Transportation Interdiction Program

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: DEA data collected on Transportation Interdiction Program
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- All data prepared or collected for the DEA Office of the Administrator's internal review of the Transportation Interdiction Program (TIP). The review was launched in November of 2024, and the results were summarized in a Jan. 8 memo from the DEA administrator:  https://ij.org/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Transportation-Interdiction-Program-Memorandum-1.8.25.pdf

In that memo, the administrator wrote: "Our comprehensive internal review looked at data from across the agency, including drug and money seizures and arrests at mass transportation facilities." I am therefore requesting this data.

Please note that the Freedom of Information Act's deliberative process privilege does not protect material that is “purely factual." Nat’l Wildlife Fed’n v. U.S. Forest Serv., 861 F.2d 1114, 1122 (9th Cir. 1988).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Daniel Bible GEO Email Metadata
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A .csv file containing metadata of all emails sent or received by email address(es) former ICE official Daniel Bible used for official government business during the period beginning January 1, 2024, and continuing through November 6, 2024, containing the domain "@geogroup.com" in the To, From, CC, or BCC lines. The .csv file metadata should contain the sender, recipient(s), date sent, time sent, date received, time received, email subject line, attachment name(s), attachment file size(s), priority status, and read receipt status. 

I make this request as a member of the media primarily engaged in information dissemination, and accordingly, request a fee waiver. 

I request expedited processing of this request under 6 C.F.R. 5.5(e), and in support thereof, I make the following statements under penalty of perjury pursuant to 28 U.S.C. 1746: 
1. A January 17, 2025, report from the Project on Government Oversight revealed former ICE official Daniel Bible notified ICE Ethics of his intent to transition from employment for ICE to employment for ICE's leading detention contractor, The GEO Group, in November 2024. See https://www.pogo.org/investigations/private-prison-giant-hired-ice-detention-chief. 

2. The end of Mr. Bible's federal employment with ICE, if it occurred, will have been less than one year before the beginning of his planned employment with The GEO Group, if it occurred.

3. Federal law prohibits certain government officials from working for contractors within one year after they leave federal government under certain circumstances. 

4. GEO previously violated this federal prohibition by hiring former ICE official Tracey Valerio as purported expert in litigation. See: https://www.thedailybeast.com/ex-ice-official-paid-to-defend-dollar1-a-day-wages-for-immigrants/. 

5. ICE Ethics imposed no publicly acknowledged penalty against GEO for violating this revolving-door provision. 

6. ICE has unlawfully refused to provide records regarding Ms. Valerio's tenure at ICE for the past six years: https://www.muckrock.com/foi/united-states-of-america-10/tracey-valerio-immigration-and-customs-enforcement-72985/#file-1037660. 

7. Similarly, former ICE custody management director and acting ICE director Tae Johnson sought and obtained employment with GEO, which began less than one year after his departure from the agency. https://www.geogroup.com/media/5twe5h5c/4ee9aaae-a38b-4f10-83eb-97c0f8f0c503.pdf. 

8. ICE has unlawfully refused to provide records regarding Mr. Johnson's tenure at ICE for the past 19 months. https://www.muckrock.com/foi/united-states-of-america-10/tae-johnson-death-emails-145670/. 

9. ICE medical officials have repeatedly concluded GEO's failure to comply with the standards set forth in ICE contracts and its own policies have contributed to or caused the deaths in federal custody at or following their detention in GEO facilities. 

10. ICE continues to contract with GEO, and is poised to enter into additional detention contracts with the company worth billions of dollars over the next several years. 

11. The public and policymakers will not have the information to evaluate the efficacy and lawfulness of these contractual arrangements if ICE continues to withhold responsive records for years. 

12. There is an urgent need to inform the public about this actual or alleged government misconduct. 

13. GEO's profitability and increased detention opportunities have been the subject of widespread media attention. See, e.g., 
a. https://www.npr.org/2025/01/16/nx-s1-5218641/immigrant-detention-trump-deportation-plans
b. https://www.sfchronicle.com/politics/article/migrants-minimum-wage-20039275.php
c. https://www.axios.com/2025/01/15/ice-detention-expansion-biden-trump-deportation
d. https://www.forbes.com/sites/michellembekeani/2025/01/12/will-mass-deportation-be-a-moneymaker-for-private-prisons/
e. https://calmatters.org/politics/capitol/2024/07/detainees-immigrants-labor-rights/
f. https://www.opensecrets.org/news/2024/07/private-prison-giant-geo-group-ramps-up-lobbying-on-immigrant-surveillance/
g. https://www.capradio.org/articles/2024/12/09/ice-is-looking-for-a-new-detention-center-in-blue-california-the-state-probably-cant-stop-it/
f. https://prismreports.org/2024/06/25/nearly-all-deaths-in-ice-detention-over-5-years-were-preventable/
g. https://prismreports.org/2024/04/01/ice-cruelty-kills-another-migrant-solitary-confinement/
h. https://newjerseymonitor.com/2024/04/19/private-prison-company-eyes-newark-site-for-new-ice-jail/
i. https://sherwood.news/markets/geo-group-ice-immigration-contractor-trump-election-bump/
j. https://www.vvdailypress.com/story/news/2024/10/22/adelanto-immigration-customs-enforcement-ice-detention-center-to-remain-open-california/75780811007/
k. https://arkansasadvocate.com/2024/08/01/private-prison-giant-geo-group-ramps-up-lobbying-on-immigrant-surveillance/


Please grant expedited processing of this request and comply with the statutory provisions of the Freedom of Information Act.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: March on the DNC 2024 Communications (CPD)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

All texts and emails sent or received by Superintendent of Police Larry Snelling from December 1, 2023 to September 1, 2024 that contain any of the following keywords or phrases: Gaza, Palestine, Israel, March on the DNC, March on the DNC 2024, U.S. Palestinian Community Network, USPCN, Bodies Outside of Unjust Laws, Coalition to March, Chicago Alliance Against Racist and Political Repression, CAARPR, sight and sound, sight & sound, genocide, protest. 

For any potentially responsive documents, please send full the conversation history and any attachments.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. I am a freelance reporter for Medill News, and I am requesting this information in that editorial capacity.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Maggie Dougherty
